revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Cities|class=start |importance=low }} {{WikiProject Georgia (country)|class=start|importance=}} {{WikiProject Abkhazia|class=start}} {{WikiProject Classical Greece and Rome|class=start |importance=low }} }} ==Box errors== In wikipedia surfing today (Pitsunda might have the tomb of St. John Chrysostom, whose feast day in some Christian denominations is tomorrow), I came across this article with ugly broken links and markup in the navbox on the right side. I don't know how to correct them, and it seems a couple involve files someone might've forgotten to upload. From this talk page and the viewhistory, it seems this wikipedia entry continues as subject of a quasi-political editing war (outside the talk page), seemingly to its detriment. I don't want to get involved in the political and geographical controversy, even if the saint was no stranger to political conflicts, which led to his exile and death nearly two millennia ago. I find this wikipedia entry particularly sad because it doesn't explain and barely contains links to the area's rich history long before the current problems between Georgia and Abkhazia (both of which wikigroups presumably monitor it). Frankly, I'd like to know if the town's name derives from the region's pine trees or hornbeams, as in an edit someone reversed (probably because it also had markup errors and political stuff). Even going to google maps on the coordinates specified, I find a nearby link to Sochi National Park (apparently Russia's first) well into the Black Sea (although the linked wikipedia article mentions its forests). Argh. [[User:Jweaver28|Jweaver28]] ([[User talk:Jweaver28|talk]]) 15:02, 12 September 2012 (UTC) == Recent edit warring == Could our tandem of [[WP:CENSORED|censors]] explain why they keep eliminating any mention of Georgia in the lead? The vague and hastily trumped-up explanations like "that would add too much details to the article" or "that's POV [because it does not meet my POV?]" have failed to convince me. --[[User:Kober|Kober]][[User talk:Kober|Talk]] 19:21, 27 June 2009 (UTC) : Calling your fellow wikieditors names is not a good way to engage in productive discussion. : Myself I have nothing against mentioning Georgia in some way in the intro, for example like it's done in [[Sukhumi]] article; alternatively we could add words 'disputed region of' in front of Abkhazia to the current article. [[User:Alaexis|Alæxis]][[User_talk:Alaexis|¿question?]] 07:53, 28 June 2009 (UTC) ::Granted, calling fellow wikieditors names is not a good way to engage in productive discussion, but it sometimes proves to be an efficient tool to encourage them to use talk page (in modern Russian dictionary this is sometimes called "operation for forcing to peace"). Since you seem to have rejected your initial rationale, I second adding "too much details" along the lines of [[Sukhumi]] to this article. It would be great if we could accept this sort of description as a standard for all Ab/SO-related geographical articles to avoid further edit wars. --[[User:Kober|Kober]][[User talk:Kober|Talk]] 08:11, 28 June 2009 (UTC) == Infobox == For the time being I have removed everything controversial from the infobox. I still do not agree with the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pitsunda&diff=577723026&oldid=572973163 changes] made by the anonymous editor because they were done without a discussion and as a result the infobox became inconsistent with all other infoboxes in articles about Abkhazian settlements. [[User:Alaexis|Alæxis]][[User_talk:Alaexis|¿question?]] 19:08, 7 December 2013 (UTC) == Bichvinta ! == User {{ping|Ghirlandajo}}, what kind of argument is this "''the name is foreign, not used in Pitsunda at all''" ?! It can't be serious lol. Name "''Georgia''" is not used in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] (Sakartvelo) at all but other English speaking world call this country as ''Georgia''. '''Bichvinta''' is very popular name for this settlement see this sources from Google books ►[http://books.google.ge/books?id=BXTmcQAACAAJ&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAQ], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=X_aoHLV02DAC&lpg=PA168&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA168#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=EZjxAAAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CD4Q6AEwAw], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=CqJ2NnGEtikC&lpg=PA39&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA39#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=mEAjAQAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CEgQ6AEwBQ], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=-VFoAAAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CE0Q6AEwBg], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=gXyMAgAAQBAJ&lpg=PT132&dq=bichvinta&pg=PT132#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=QWwJ54CddmoC&lpg=PA114&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA114#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=_4w53b3LiAsC&lpg=PA78&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA78#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false]. So ... --[[User:Giorgi Balakhadze|g. balaxaZe]][[User talk:Giorgi Balakhadze|★]] 12:50, 8 April 2014 (UTC) :A note to all parties bickering over details in this article: this is English Wikipedia, therefore the English [[WP:COMMONNAME]] is overrides any other personal preferences. Per [https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=Bichvinta%2C+Pitsunda&year_start=1800&year_end=2000&corpus=15&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2CBichvinta%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2CPitsunda%3B%2Cc0 ngram for corpus English], Pitsunda is undoubtedly the primary naming convention. Bichvinta, however, also appears more recently, therefore could also be represented as secondary. I have removed it from the conventional name in the infobox and retained it as 'other name'. The fact that both names feature in the lead makes it amply evident that another naming convention exists. --[[User:Iryna Harpy|Iryna Harpy]] ([[User talk:Iryna Harpy|talk]]) 00:07, 18 April 2014 (UTC) *The most common name in English is Pitsunda and that should be name of the article. According to this: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Pitsunda we could easly see, that Pitsunda is the English name, and Bichvinta ბიჭვინთა (bičvint’a) is a Georgian name. Also in that town (Abkhaz version)/village (Georgian version) there is no evidence of existance of the name Bichvinta. You can't find any of image showing the name Bichvinta. Also, name Pitsunda is used in the maps like Google mpas and others: https://www.google.pl/maps/@43.1589074,40.3406931,15z. Also, name of the most famous sight from that place is [[Pitsunda Cathedral|Pitsunda catherdal]], not Bichvinta Cathedral. Naming the article Bichvinta (insted of Pitsunda) by Giorgi Balakhadze without giving the proofs, that this is a the most common widespread version, is unacceptable. [[User:Halavar|Halavar]] ([[User talk:Halavar|talk]]) 00:46, 30 December 2014 (UTC) **No one says that '''Bichvinta''' is the only common name in English, but after Russian influenced Pitsunda, Bichvinta in secondly used name! Your edits disregarding this. Also as you can see the article's link name is '''Pitsunda'''. Existence of the name Bichvinta is proved by [https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=Bichvinta%2C+Pitsunda&year_start=1800&year_end=2000&corpus=15&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2CBichvinta%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2CPitsunda%3B%2Cc0 ngram viewer] and numerous English literature: [http://books.google.ge/books?id=BXTmcQAACAAJ&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAQ], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=X_aoHLV02DAC&lpg=PA168&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA168#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=EZjxAAAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CD4Q6AEwAw], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=CqJ2NnGEtikC&lpg=PA39&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA39#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=mEAjAQAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CEgQ6AEwBQ], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=-VFoAAAAMAAJ&q=bichvinta&dq=bichvinta&hl=en&sa=X&ei=su1DU_PON6eCzAOm5YHICg&ved=0CE0Q6AEwBg], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=gXyMAgAAQBAJ&lpg=PT132&dq=bichvinta&pg=PT132#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=QWwJ54CddmoC&lpg=PA114&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA114#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false], [http://books.google.ge/books?id=_4w53b3LiAsC&lpg=PA78&dq=bichvinta&pg=PA78#v=onepage&q=bichvinta&f=false] --[[User:Giorgi Balakhadze|g. balaxaZe]][[User talk:Giorgi Balakhadze|✰]] 01:06, 30 December 2014 (UTC) {{replyto|Halavar}} The [[WP:TITLE]] of the article has not been changed by anyone, nor has there been any renaming of landmarks. There is, however, ample evidence that Bichvinta is used, therefore (per [[Template:Infobox settlement]]) other names with significance are allowed. I am having difficulty in understanding what your specific problem with the naming convention is, particularly as the google map you pulled up depicts Bichvinta beach, Bichvinta Bay, Pitsunda-Miusera Nature Reserve (but written in Georgian a Bichvinta), etc... and written in Georgian. --[[User:Iryna Harpy|Iryna Harpy]] ([[User talk:Iryna Harpy|talk]]) 05:29, 30 December 2014 (UTC) {{replyto|Halavar}}, what's your actual point? Giorgi Balakhadze is adding the second most commonly used name to the article. Noone is moving the article to a new title. Just because you cannot perform proper searching does not mean that the Georgian name is invalid. Image search has nothing to do with that and Google Maps is not an academic source. Please consult [[WP:SOURCE]], [[WP:NAME]]. Here's are the Google Book results: [https://www.google.com/webhp?rls=ig&gws_rd=ssl#rls=ig&tbm=bks&q=%22Bichvinta%22 "Bichvinta"], [https://www.google.com/webhp?rls=ig&gws_rd=ssl#rls=ig&tbm=bks&q=%22Bitchvinta%22 "Bitchvinta"], [https://www.google.com/webhp?rls=ig&gws_rd=ssl#rls=ig&tbm=bks&q=%22Bicvinta%22 "Bicvinta"], [https://www.google.com/webhp?rls=ig&gws_rd=ssl#rls=ig&tbm=bks&q=%22Bic%27vint%27a%22 "Bic'vint'a"]. As early as in the 1830s, a French traveller wrote: [https://books.google.ge/books?id=wJoLAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA241&dq=%22Bitchvinta%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=OTaiVJq5N8fUOpPGgOgE&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22Bitchvinta%22&f=false "Cette ville c'est l'antique Pithyus, Pitzounda , et , selon la prononciation des habitants du pays et des Géorgiens, Bitchvinda ou Bitchvinta, bâtie à un quart de verst de l'église"], that is, "This town is the ancient Pithyus, Pitzounda, whose name is pronounced '''by the locals and the Georgians as Bitchvinda or Bitchvinta'''." --[[User:Kober|Kober]][[User talk:Kober|Talk]] 05:35, 30 December 2014 (UTC) == Another bout of edit warring == I would ask that everyone developing this article use this talk page for discussion and consensus. Lengthy, argumentative edit summaries such as [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pitsunda&diff=prev&oldid=603325175 these], and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pitsunda&diff=next&oldid=603325925 these] while edit warring are ''not'' a substitute for discussion and consensus on the talk page before making changes. --[[User:Iryna Harpy|Iryna Harpy]] ([[User talk:Iryna Harpy|talk]]) 00:31, 18 April 2014 (UTC) == Georgian Kingdom of Colchis? == Is there any evidence that there is any Kartvelian association with Colchis? Georgian itself is a word invented long after the name Colchis for a land far East. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/78.172.99.189|78.172.99.189]] ([[User talk:78.172.99.189|talk]]) 19:05, 14 December 2014 (UTC) :See [[Colchis]], the disambiguation page for [[Kartvelian]], and [[Proto-Kartvelian language]]. Other than that, I'm not certain as to what your point is. --[[User:Iryna Harpy|Iryna Harpy]] ([[User talk:Iryna Harpy|talk]]) 05:02, 15 December 2014 (UTC) == Title of the article == Hello, On 16 September 2015, at the request of the Permanent Mission of Georgia to the [[United Nations]], the map of Georgia was updated on the website of the Geospatial Information Section of the United Nations. The English language orthography of several cities on Georgia's Black Sea coast has been changed in accordance with the established norms of Georgian toponyms: სოხუმი/Sokhumi, ბიჭვინთა/Bichvinta, ახალი ათონი/Akhali Atoni, გულრიფში/Gulripshi and ოჩამჩირე/Ochamchire. [[https://www.facebook.com/126574927525610/photos/a.151996894983413.1073741828.126574927525610/428335727349527/?type=1&theater]] [[http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/georgia.pdf]] According to this regulations, made by the Uited Nations, please, change the title of the article into '''Bichvinta''' and use this form in any other articles of Wikipedia. Also note, that according to this official UN map of Georgia, the primary name of Abkhazia part of Georgia is '''Abkhazeti'''. Thank you![[User:Abkhazian1|Abkhazian1]] ([[User talk:Abkhazian1|talk]]) 06:49, 18 September 2015 (UTC)
